column4: I have a noob Q .. lol ... does this command actually work ? >> sudo apt-get remove --force-yes .. Do I add the pkg name in the end ?
odd command
if you want to remove a program and it's config files this will work :)   sudo apt-get purge programname
I can't see a need to use force in the command you gave,  you could just  sudo apt-get remove programname  and  that will leave config files or whaetver to
: .. I wish I can burn those pkg config files lol ! is there anyway :| !!
purge is for the program and it's config
you could burn the stuff from /etc onto a CD I assume
config files???
: .. Yea I know and tried that it doesnt work :( .. .. and by burn I really mean BURN with fire ! :P
are you usre your not getting mixed up here with program user data, for example the hidden .mozilla in home, which is your Firefox profile
are you sure above
: 1004112 kB equals how many GB :P ?
don't know
: so I can .deb packages but never a debian repository ?
Some  DEBS I think are made for both Ubuntu and Debian,  but most will only be made for Ubuntu or Debian
or Debs are only made for Debian or Ubuntu
by adding the Debian repos you will end up getting  Debian Debs, not Ubuntu Debs

: ok .. I have this experimental debian repository in my sources.list ... and I have done an update after it ...someone in here thinks it might be the cause of the flashplugin broken package ... can I remove it all without a fresh reinstall of Ubuntu !!!?

using Debian repos in Ubuntu is a bad idea,  it might have caused your issue,  but  recently  I have noticed a lot of people having problems with installing  Flash in here,  and none of them added a Debian repo
weird how installing Flash  seems to have become a common 9.04 issue
: .. I would love just to remove the flash from my ubuntu right now ! lol
simple by knowing if you  have a 64bit proccessor or not
